title: If You Want Better Sleep, Skin, and Hair, You Need a Silk Pillowcase

html:
Editor’s Pick

Slip Queen Silk Pillow Case

Pros

  • Zipper closure keeps everything secure

Not only does Dr. Mraz recommend this one, but you’d probably find a Slip on pretty much every beauty editor’s bed. They’re chic, come in a variety of colors, and do everything you’d want a silk pillowcase to do. “I’m a side (and sometimes stomach) sleeper, so a silk pillowcase is essential for me,” shares ELLE commerce lead Alexis Bennett Parker. “Not only is it softer on my face and great at minimizing sleep wrinkles, but it also acts as a backup protection for my hair when my scarf comes undone in the middle of the night.”

Material: 100 percent mulberry silk

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I’ve purchased several silk pillowcases in the past, and I was hesitant to get this one based on the price. This pillow case is so cool to the touch. It doesn’t seem to make me overheat at night (which is great for my crazy hormones), and my skin loves it. I have rosacea, and anything and everything seems to bother my skin, but this pillowcase does not irritate it at all! I also have super fine hair, and my hair isn’t a knotted rat’s nest when I wake up!”

Dermatologist-Approved

Blissy Silk Pillowcase

Pros

  • Convenient zipper closure

Cons

  • Needs extra care when washing

This is another one of Dr. Mraz’s favorites, and she’s not the only dermatologist who’s a fan. The pillowcase will help your skin and hair retain hydration instead of sucking out the moisture like other fabrics might—leading to clearer, smoother skin and sleeker strands.

Material: 100 percent mulberry silk

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I wasn’t sure if a silk pillowcase would make a difference, but I’m glad I got this one. It’s super soft, cool to the touch, and I’ve noticed my hair is way less frizzy in the mornings. The hidden zipper is a nice touch, and it stays in place all night. Definitely feels high quality, and it looks really nice on my bed. Worth it!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Industry Favorite

Fishers Finery 100% Pure Mulberry Silk Pillowcase

Pros

  • Stays cool throughout the night

Cons

  • Needs to be air dried

Editors adore Fishers Finery’s version too, which features extra dense silk for an even more luxurious feel—once you get it into your hands, you’ll be able to tell that it’s designed to last. Plus if you don’t care for a zipper (which tends to be the first thing that falls apart on my pillowcases), this option has an envelope flap to keep your pillow in place.

Material: 100 percent mulberry silk

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “My skin seems to respond the best to it (no breakouts, no wrinkles from sleeping on my side), it’s not particularly slippery like some of the blends end up being, no noticeable off-gassing of any scent, and no zipper. It feels very posh to have the sewn fold end to keep the pillow secure. Fits my weird cervicogenic foam pillow perfectly with the queen size. Ordered a second one so I can continue my habits.”

Best Mulberry Silk Option

Quince 100% Mulberry Silk Pillowcase

Pros

  • Durable material
  • Dries quickly

Cons

  • Some have trouble with zipper

Okay, I know that some of you may still balk at spending 40+ dollars on a pillowcase. But at this price, Quince’s is a steal. Countless reviewers agree, with one writing, “We’ve used a few different brands of silk pillowcases over the years, and all of them were more expensive yet fell apart way quicker than these ones have. We have our first set of Quince silk pillowcases from a year ago, and they are still in great condition—no tearing or falling apart anywhere.”

Material: 100 percent mulberry silk

Quince rating: 4.9/5 stars

A Quince reviewer says: “The mulberry silk pillowcase is definitely worth it. The silk stays cool and breathes well. Your skin and hair stay hydrated, and no frizzy hair in the morning.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Investment

Parachute Home Silk Pillowcase

Pros

  • No need to iron smooth
  • Prevents bedhead

Cons

  • White color has a slightly gray tone

I love Parachute—when I began my search for “forever bedding” a few years ago, I landed on the brand after seeing it mentioned on the r/BuyItForLife subreddit. This silk pillowcase is an investment for sure, but reviewers emphasize that you’ll get your money’s worth.

Material: 100 percent mulberry silk

Parachute rating: 4.6/5 stars

A Parachute reviewer says: “It is so comforting for a good night’s rest. I tend to be a stomach sleeper, and with this pillowcase, I enjoy waking up feeling fresh and dewy with no pillow wrinkles on my face.”

Affordable Find

ZimaSilk 100% Pure Mulberry Silk Pillowcase

Pros

  • Some say it can withstand tumble drying
  • Stains wash out easily

Cons

  • May feel thinner than competitors

This Amazon favorite is priced competitively and is designed to feel pretty darn close to pricier options, keeping morning lines, acne, and bedhead at bay. It’s perfect for anyone who wants to board the silk pillowcase train but isn’t ready to shell out the big bucks.

Material: 100 percent mulberry silk

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “Silk pillowcases are hands down the best possible material you can buy for your hair and face health while sleeping. I had a silk case from a different brand for about two years when the material around the zipper ripped. I decided to replace it with this brand, and it’s even smoother and better quality than my first, but about $20 less. I’ve been sleeping on it for about a month now, and it’s a very nice pillowcase. Definitely recommend.”

Meet the Expert

How often should you wash silk pillowcases?

“I would advise swapping/washing every three sleeps,” Dr. Mraz says.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What kind of sleeping posture is best for preventing wrinkles?

Dr. Mraz recommends sleeping a little elevated and completely on your back. “This would be the best position to avoid wrinkles and fluid retention at night,” she says.
